#Text=Ontario Votes 2007 : Interview with Green Party candidate Gordon Kubanek , Nepean
#Text=Carleton
#Text=Tuesday , October 9 , 2007
#Text=Gordon Kubanek is running for the Green Party of Ontario in the Ontario provincial election , in the Nepean-Carleton riding .
#Text=Wikinews ' Nick Moreau interviewed him regarding his values , his experience , and his campaign .
#Text=Stay tuned for further interviews ; every candidate from every party is eligible , and will be contacted .

#Text=Expect interviews from Liberals , Progressive Conservatives , New Democratic Party members , Ontario Greens , as well as members from the Family Coalition , Freedom , Communist , Libertarian , and Confederation of Regions parties , as well as independents .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=Why did you choose to run in this constituency ?
#Text=Three years ago I moved out of the city to live the country life but a virus from my new environment gave me congestive heart failure .
#Text=During my three year recovery period I promised myself that IF I recovered I would find a new purpose to my life .
#Text=That purpose is helping the Green Party to bring a saner and healthier way of living to Ontario .
#Text=What prior political experience do you have ?
#Text=What skills and insight can you bring to office , from other non-political positions you may have held ?

#Text=Previously I was the riding president for the federal Conservative party in Ottawa ; am the federal Green party riding president ; have helped out in 3 campaigns , worked with many school initiatives in the public school I teach in and on several committees in the school my children attend .
#Text=My experience living and working in Europe , USA , Australia and Canada have given me a global perspective that none of the other local candidates have .

#Text=My consulting work of the Department of National Defence using a computer modeling methodology called " System Dynamics " [ the same method used to create scenarios for the world 's future in the classic ' Limits to Growth " ] give me a real experience how we MUST think ahead and act BEFORE big problems happen by changing how we live and behave pro-actively .
